verses.verse: And Miriam<WH4813> and Aaron<WH175> spake<WH1696> against Moses<WH4872> because of<WH182> the Cushite<WH3571> woman<WH802> whom he had married<WH3947>; for he had married<WH3947> a Cushite<WH3571> woman<WH802>.
And they said<WH559>, Hath Jehovah<WH3068> indeed spoken<WH1696> only with Moses<WH4872>? hath he not spoken<WH1696> also with us<WH3068>? And Jehovah heard it<WH8085>.
Now the man<WH376> Moses<WH4872> was very<WH3966> meek<WH6035>, above all the men<WH120> that were upon the face<WH6440> of the earth<WH127>.

And Jehovah<WH3068> spake<WH559> suddenly<WH6597> unto Moses<WH4872>, and unto Aaron<WH175>, and unto Miriam<WH4813>, Come out<WH3318> ye three<WH7969> unto the tent<WH168> of meeting<WH4150>. And they three<WH7969> came out<WH3318>.

And Jehovah<WH3068> came down<WH3381> in a pillar<WH5982> of cloud<WH6051>, and stood<WH5975> at the door<WH6607> of the Tent<WH168>, and called<WH7121> Aaron<WH175> and Miriam<WH4813>; and they both<WH8147> came forth<WH3318>.

And he said<WH559>, Hear<WH8085> now my words<WH1697>: if there be a prophet<WH5030> among you<WH3068>, I Jehovah will make myself known<WH3045> unto him in a vision<WH4759>, I will speak<WH1696> with him in a dream<WH2472>.
My servant<WH5650> Moses<WH4872> is not so<WH539>; he is faithful in all my house<WH1004>:

with him will I speak<WH1696> mouth<WH6310> to mouth<WH6310>, even manifestly<WH4758>, and not in dark speeches<WH2420>; and the form<WH8544> of Jehovah<WH3068> shall he behold<WH5027>: wherefore then were ye not afraid<WH3372> to speak<WH1696> against my servant<WH5650>, against Moses<WH4872>?
And the anger<WH639> of Jehovah<WH3068> was kindled<WH2734> against them<WH3212>; and he departed.

And the cloud<WH6051> removed<WH5493> from over the Tent<WH168>; and<WH4813>, behold, Miriam was leprous<WH6879>, as white as snow<WH7950>: and Aaron<WH175> looked<WH6437> upon Miriam<WH4813>, and<WH6879>, behold, she was leprous.

And Aaron<WH175> said<WH559> unto Moses<WH4872>, Oh<WH994>, my lord<WH113>, lay<WH7896> not<WH2403>, I pray thee, sin upon us<WH2973>, for that we have done foolishly, and for that we have sinned<WH2398>.
Let her not<WH4994>, I pray, be as one dead, of whom the flesh<WH1320> is half<WH2677> consumed<WH398> when he cometh out<WH3318> of his mother<WH517>'s womb<WH7358>.
And Moses<WH4872> cried<WH6817> unto Jehovah<WH3068>, saying<WH559>, Heal<WH7495> her<WH410>, O God, I beseech thee.

And Jehovah<WH3068> said<WH559> unto Moses<WH4872>, If her father<WH1> had but<WH3417> spit<WH3417> in her face<WH6440>, should she not be ashamed<WH3637> seven<WH7651> days<WH3117>? let her be shut<WH5462> up without<WH2351> the camp<WH4264> seven<WH7651> days<WH3117>, and after<WH310> that she shall be brought in again<WH622>.
And Miriam<WH4813> was shut<WH5462> up without<WH2351> the camp<WH4264> seven<WH7651> days<WH3117>: and the people<WH5971> journeyed<WH5265> not till Miriam<WH4813> was brought in again<WH622>.
And afterward<WH310> the people<WH5971> journeyed<WH5265> from Hazeroth<WH2698>, and encamped<WH2583> in the wilderness<WH4057> of Paran<WH6290>.
